alert.note: Alert for Jemez Mountains; Santa Fe Metro Area (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 11 at 7:23PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHEASTERN LOS ALAMOS, EAST CENTRAL SANDOVAL AND NORTHWESTERN SANTA FE COUNTIES THROUGH 800 PM MDT... At 723 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Frijoles, or 10 miles south of Los Alamos, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... White Rock, La Bajada, Bandelier National Monument, Cochiti Lake, Frijoles and La Cienega. This includes Interstate 25 near Mile Marker 265. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Motorists can expect brief but sudden changes in visibility and ponding of water on highways as storms move through the area. Persons in campgrounds should seek sturdy shelter until this storm passes.

area.areaDesc: Jemez Mountains; Santa Fe Metro Area
